hints.content:
There are $\goldE{200}\text { mL}$ of orange juice.


[[☃ image 1]]

options.alt: A graduated cylinder labeled with tick marks from 50 milliliters to 300 milliliters. Tick marks 50, 100, 150, 200, 250, and 300 milliliters are labeled. 1 unlabeled tick mark is shown before 50 milliliters and 1 unlabeled tick mark is between every 2 labeled tick marks. The orange juice inside the graduated cylinder measures to the tick mark 200 milliliters. A line extends from the tick mark at 200 milliliters and is labeled 200 milliliters. !

hints.content:
There are $\purpleD{250}\text { mL}$ of grape juice.  

[[☃ image 1]]

options.alt: A graduated cylinder labeled with tick marks from 50 milliliters to 300 milliliters. Tick marks 50, 100, 150, 200, 250, and 300 milliliters are labeled. 1 unlabeled tick mark is shown before 50 milliliters and 1 unlabeled tick mark is between every 2 labeled tick marks. The grape juice inside the graduated cylinder measures to the tick mark 250 milliliters. A line extends from the tick mark at 250 milliliters and is labeled 250 milliliters. !

hints.content:
We add the measurements together to find how many milliliters of fruit juice he will combine.

[[☃ image 1]]

options.alt: Two rectangles sit on top of each other. The top rectangle is labeled with a question mark. A curved bracket across the top rectangle is labeled Total volume. The bottom rectangle is divided into 2 parts. The shorter left part is labeled 200 milliliters. The longer right part is labeled 250 milliliters. A curved bracket across the shorter left part of the bottom rectangle is labeled Orange. A curved bracket across the longer right part of the bottom rectangle is labeled Grape. !

hints.content: He will make $\greenD{450}\text { mL}$ of fruit punch.

question.content:
Benardo is making fruit punch by combining all of the orange and grape juice shown below.

[[☃ image 1]]

[[☃ image 2]]

**How many milliliters of fruit punch will he make?**  

[[☃ input-number 1]] milliliters

options.alt: A graduated cylinder labeled with tick marks from 50 milliliters to 300 milliliters. Tick marks 50, 100, 150, 200, 250, and 300 milliliters are labeled. 1 unlabeled tick mark is shown before 50 milliliters and 1 unlabeled tick mark is between every 2 labeled tick marks. The orange juice inside the graduated cylinder measures to the tick mark 200 milliliters. !
